title: Enterprise Architecture
text: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed commodo dictum neque, lobortis lobortis arcu blandit ut. Ut dignissim nunc.
fullText: In today’s world an agile enterprise is required to enable business goals and objectives. This is accomplished by understanding current capability and maturity across people, process, information and technology; identifying gaps between current and target state; and formulating the strategy and roadmap needed to realize the transformed IT organization.
points: Information Management, Business Intelligence and Analytics

title: App/Solution Architecture
text: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed commodo dictum neque, lobortis lobortis arcu blandit ut. Ut dignissim nunc.
fullText: Understanding applications and processes that are critical to the business, assessing in terms of business and technology fit, and developing a pragmatic architecture and solution that enables the business.

title: Data/Integration Architecture
text: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed commodo dictum neque, lobortis lobortis arcu blandit ut. Ut dignissim nunc.
fullText: Identifying information assets that are key to business decision making and customer experience, understanding data quality, management, governance, integration, and consumption in order to develop a go-forward strategy and architecture that will enable next-generation BI capabilities.
points: Data Governance, Data Quality and Master Data Management

title: Agile Implementation
text: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed commodo dictum neque, lobortis lobortis arcu blandit ut. Ut dignissim nunc.
fullText: Providing leadership, proven delivery approaches and best practices to successfully deliver complex enterprise initiatives.

title: Project Audit & Review
text: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed commodo dictum neque, lobortis lobortis arcu blandit ut. Ut dignissim nunc.
fullText: Reviewing project direction and progress; assessing the suitability of established architecture vision and objectives; assessing the project team’s ability to deliver desired business capabilities across people, process, and technology dimensions; evaluating the current state against industry best practices, peer benchmarks, and X by 2 experience; providing objective recommendations, opportunities, and a go-forward strategy to shore up identified issues.
